articles.author: Andrew Throuvalas
articles.description: The company will redirect resources toward its crypto custody and asset management businesses from here on.
articles.title: Nasdaq-Listed Eqonex Shuts Down Crypto Exchange Due to Low Volume, 'Intense Competition'

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Galaxy Digital today said it would no longer acquire BitGo in what would have been a massive deal in the crypto world. BitGo is now suing.

articles.description: The company acquired 9,000 new mining rigs and increased its hash rate, but lagging Bitcoin prices still hurt its bottom line.

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The non-profit advocacy group says the ban may be unconstitutional.
articles.title: Coin Center Says It May Challenge Tornado Cash Ban in Court

articles.description: Mike Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital will not pursue its planned acquisition of crypto custody firm BitGo, it announced today.
articles.title: Galaxy Digital Pulls Plug on $1.2 Billion BitGo Acquisition

articles.author: Emily Tonelli
articles.description: Hackers used an exploit to mint 1.28 billion aUSD tokens, prompting the stablecoin to lose its peg to the U.S. dollar.
articles.title: Acala Exploit Causes Polkadot-Based DeFi Platform’s Stablecoin to Drop 99%

articles.author: Stephen Graves
articles.description: Privacy coin Monero has deployed a non-contentious hard fork to boost its privacy and security feature set.
articles.title: Monero Rolls Out Enhanced Privacy Features With Hard Fork

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: After reclaiming the $2,000 level last week amid mounting anticipation for its upcoming Merge event, Ethereum has slipped over the past 24 hours.
articles.title: Ethereum Slumps 5% as Merge Surge Falters

articles.description: With $3.41 billion in trading volume over the last 24 hours, SHIB hit highs not seen since May.
articles.title: SHIB Spikes on Sunday, Dogecoin Climbs

articles.description: The prices of leading cryptocurrencies began to rebound, but the state of the industry still gave Crypto Twitter plenty to criticize.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Tornado Cash Sanctions Slammed, Vitalik Criticizes MakerDAO Proposal

articles.author: Shuyao Kong
articles.description: Yes, Virginia, there is such a thing as “productive capitulation.” Here's how to get realistic and efficient about bearing this bear market.
articles.title: Brother Bing’s Guide to Surviving the Crypto Bear Market

articles.description: The Feds sanctioning Tornado Cash and the deplatforming of crypto content creators by Mailchimp were the latest signs of a broader anti-crypto wave.
articles.title: War on Crypto! From Ethereum Mixers to Media Newsletters

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The price of the biggest cryptocurrency by market cap finally resurfaced above the $25,000 mark—then quickly sank back.
articles.title: Bitcoin Tops $25K for First Time in 9 Weeks

articles.description: Leading coins rose in anticipation of the Ethereum merge. But there are still signs of ongoing liquidity problems in the industry.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum and Avalanche Rally, Crypto Winter Still Not Over

articles.description: Since Monday's crackdown on Torndao Cash, the DeFi sector is faced with a choice: remain proudly non-compliant or bend the knee.
articles.title: Crackdown on Tornado Cash Was Just Round 1

articles.description: The Merge is right around the corner in September, and Ethereum believers are showing their excitement by buying up ETH.
articles.title: Ethereum Tops $2,000 as Network Approaches Merge Event

articles.description: The coin mixer’s governance token price has steadily declined since regulators took action on Monday.
articles.title: Tornado Cash Ethereum Token TORN Down 50% After Sanctions

articles.description: Bitcoin transactions are easily traced. Here’s what’s going on behind the scenes to change that.
articles.title: Bitcoin’s Privacy Problem—And What Cypherpunks Are Doing to Solve It

articles.description: The top marketplace will require a police report for NFTs that are said to be stolen, and is considering further tweaks.
articles.title: OpenSea Changes Stolen NFT Policy Following User Outcry

articles.description: Tornado Cash and similar services have “mixed” billions of dollars in cryptocurrency—much of it for legitimate uses, but some to hide funds stolen by hackers.

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: The CFTC claims an Ohio man and his associates used would-be investors’ cash and Bitcoin to fund a lavish lifestyle.
articles.title: CFTC Files Charges Against $12 Million 'Bitcoin Ponzi Scheme'

articles.description: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is the man of the moment in crypto as he has bailed out multiple insolvent companies. Some are calling him Atlas, some sarcastically calling him savior. Sam answers tough questions from Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on FTX's bailout strategy, the controversial Voyager loan, his market outlook, marketing mistakes by crypto lenders, FTX competitors Binance and Coinbase, his political donations, and what he's learned about management.
articles.title: gm: Sam Bankman-Fried, Crypto Savior?

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: Before the governance forum was taken down, the community approved a proposal to switch to a 4 of 6 multisignature on its $22 million treasury.
articles.title: Tornado DAO Grapples With Arrests as Discord, Governance Forum Go Dark

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: The wider crypto community has erupted on Twitter following the news of an alleged Tornado Cash developer’s arrest in the Netherlands.
articles.title: 'Welcome to the War on Code': Crypto Twitter Reacts to Arrest of Alleged Tornado Cash Dev

articles.description: A suspected developer of Ethereum mixing service Tornado Cash has been arrested in the Netherlands, with more arrests "not ruled out."
articles.title: Dutch Police Arrest Alleged Tornado Cash Dev, More Arrests 'Not Ruled Out': Financial Crimes Unit

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried and Justin Sun are reportedly among investors looking to acquire a majority stake in crypto exchange Huobi Global.
articles.title: Huobi Chief in Talks to Sell $1 Billion Stake in Crypto Exchange: Report

articles.description: Binance CEO today reported that the crypto exchange managed to recover roughly 83% of the funds stolen from Curve Finance on Monday.
articles.title: Crypto Exchange Binance Freezes $450,000 From Curve Finance Hack

articles.description: The upswing in ETC’s price coincides with the upswing of ETH.
articles.title: Ethereum Classic Hits 4-Month High as Merge Approaches

articles.description: Celsius creditors have also filed a statement calling CEO Alex Mashinsky's assurances to customers "empty and false promises."
articles.title: Celsius Creditors Move to Block Company From Selling Mined Bitcoin

articles.description: As tensions with China heat up, Taipei officials leverage decentralized publishing and storage to stay online.
articles.title: Taiwan Turns to Ethereum IPFS Tech to Thwart Chinese Cyberattacks

articles.description: The FTX CEO said he doesn't want to be the only one bailing out ailing crypto companies, but hasn't gotten any help from other healthy players.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried: 'Disappointing' Others Haven’t Helped Us Give Bailouts

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: Over 50% of DAI is currently collateralized by Circle’s USDC.
articles.title: MakerDAO Founder Calls on DAI to Drop Dollar Peg Amid Tornado Cash Fallout

articles.description: The merge is now expected to take place on September 15 or 16, according to a call today among Ethereum developers.
articles.title: Ethereum Merge May Be Coming Sooner Than Expected

articles.description: The $10 trillion asset manager said it’s also exploring “permissioned blockchains, stablecoins, cryptoassets, and tokenization.”
articles.title: BlackRock Launches Spot Bitcoin Private Trust

articles.description: The exchange took decisive action to block crypto addresses associated with Tornado Cash following this week’s sanctions blow from the U.S.
articles.title: DeFi Exchange dYdX Blocking Addresses Associated With Tornado Cash

articles.description: A post-mortem from Curve Finance reported that “no one is safe” from frontend attacks like the one the DeFi exchange suffered on Tuesday.
articles.title: Curve ‘Strongly Suggests’ Domain Migration to Ethereum Name Service After $570K Frontend Hack

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Crypto trading app Swan Bitcoin is among dozens of crypto businesses affected by a data breach suffered by email marketing firm Klaviyo.
articles.title: Swan Bitcoin Discloses Data Leak Due to Phishing Attack on Newsletter Provider

articles.description: The token backing popular Ethereum staker Lido jumped double-digits after the final test before the merge next month.
articles.title: DeFi Token Powering Ethereum Staker Lido Finance Jumps 18%

articles.description: Experts assess the implications of the Treasury Department’s sanctioning of privacy protocol Tornado Cash earlier this week.
articles.title: Did The US Government Just Declare War on Crypto?

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Ethereum has just completed the network’s final dress rehearsal before the Merge event slated for September.
articles.title: Ethereum Up 14% as Goerli Testnet Merge Goes Live

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Another round of unannounced account suspensions leaves crypto newsletter publishers scrambling to choose a new provider.
articles.title: Mailchimp Resumes Crackdown on Crypto Newsletters Including Messari, Edge

articles.description: Musician and NFT artist Jimmy Edgar is fully sold on NFT art, but not convinced yet on the uses of NFTs in the music world, he told Decrypt's Kate Irwin.
articles.title: Why Musician and NFT Artist Jimmy Edgar Remains Skeptical on Music NFTs

articles.description: Ava Labs President John Wu sits for an extensive chat about institutional interest in crypto and DeFi (it has "absolutely not waned") and use cases of Avalanche with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Avalanche House in Brooklyn on July 15, 2022.
articles.title: Avalanche's John Wu Talks Institutional Interest and Use Cases

articles.description:
In our latest Decrypt on the Street segment, reporter Sander Lutz investigates Chipotle’s recent crypto marketing campaign and talks to Chipotle customers about their sadness amid the crypto crash. 

Sander himself entered the contest hoping to get rich; instead he got a single cup of queso dip.
articles.title: Decrypt on the Street: Chipotle Says ‘Buy the Dip!’

articles.description: Decrypt's Jason Nelson reports from NFT Expoverse in LA with JP Bedoya, Chief Product Officer at Civic, the Web3 identity verification problem rolling out a new set of tools to keep people from spamming NFT drops to take advantage.
articles.title: How Civic Is Battling Web3 Bots and Spam: CPO JP Bedoya

articles.description: Art Blocks, the generative NFT series, exploded in popularity and price last fall. Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon (aka "Snowfro") talks to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves all about why the price surge actually hurt Art Blocks and the problem with NFT speculators, the debate over digital art vs. traditional art and his views on Bored Apes and CryptoPunks, how he got into NFTs after starting a physical tile business with his father, and why he thinks everyone's mortgage will eventually be stored on chain.
articles.title: gm: Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon is Finding the 'Soul' in Generative Art NFTs

articles.description: The former Amazon Studios exec and venture capitalist spoke with Decrypt’s Kate Irwin about how crypto fits into the metaverse at an event in Beverly Hills, California.
articles.title: Matthew Ball on the Role of Crypto and NFTs in the Metaverse
